summary_comment: Professor Harrill is highly knowledgeable and passionate about his subject, effectively connecting biblical studies to contemporary issues. His lectures are engaging and thought-provoking, though some students find his teaching style traditional and challenging. Grading is rigorous, emphasizing thorough understanding and critical thinking, which can be demanding but ultimately rewarding.

Ratings.comment: This was an interesting class, but there were definitely some moments where I had to take a moment and question the things he was teaching. Good information on the history of the Bible, but some interpretations I just couldn't agree with. Also, the only grades in the grade book were exams and one paper. So you really have to do well on everything.

This was not one of those typical GE classes where you learn things to pass exams and quizzes, just to forget it a few months after.  What I have learned in this class will stay with me forever and, in all honesty, this class did change my life.  I'm considering switching to become a history major.

Prof. Harrill taught me things I didn't even know I could learn about the Bible. He really knows his stuff and connects the content to issues in today's world. Ask him questions and push him for more information if you do  not fully understand it the first time. He is a great professor and overall an intersting human!

As an engineering student, I am so happy I was able to take Professor Harrill's history course.  Beyond his expertise, he is genuinely interested in connecting with his students.  Some of the most amazing intellectual conversations I have ever had were in his Office Hours.  He is there to see his students succeed, and to think like a scholar.

Dr. Harrill was extremely knowledgeable of religion and history. He is a tough grader, so this is not a "background elective" to take, he grades for perfection. He's awesome, but I would probably not take him again due to the tough grading; one bad test nearly failed me. However, he's a person I would stay in touch with postgrad. Great guy

Easy to get a B, hard to get an A. Requires 7 textbooks, which altogether cost me $200 bucks. The highest possible grade you can get on a paper is 95% and those are only the ones that "thoroughly impressed" him. He makes mistakes about the background frequently, like saying Caesar killed Cicero. Extra credit is impossible to earn. Exams are easy.

This was an extremely well taught class and Professor Harrill is clearly extremely knowledgeable.  It made me think about this amazing text in a whole new way.  He clearly loves his subject. His old school lecture style with no power point might scare some away but he is a very captivating speaker and I loved learning from him.

This was by far my favorite class of my entire freshman year. The homework/reading assignments were effective and the lectures were intellectually engaging. The entire course was structured very well, nicely planned out. I have recommended this class to many of my peers and am grateful I got the opportunity to learn from such a great professor!

Professor Harrill is the standard all professors should aspire to be. I thoroughly enjoyed how this course made me think about scripture. I've never met a professor who cared about his students learning as much as Professor Harrill. Everyday in his class was an enlightening experience. This meant so much during a pandemic.

I learned more about writing good papers in this class than in my freshman rhetoric and composition course. I also learned how to read in history courses. Prof. Harrill spends a great deal of time helping students to understand the material, individually in office hours. Extremely good teacher!
By far the best professor I've had at OSU!! He's so inspiring as a teacher. Take him!

I really enjoyed taking his class. His lectures were always engaging and fascinating to listen to and was always willing to challenge preconceptions and ideas. There is a lot of reading and taking notes was necessary in order to do well on midterms but overall he was one of the best professors I have ever had.

This class blew my mind every day! Ive always been interested in both history and the Bible, and this course helped with that. I enjoyed the class and the prof for making me think for myself. Go to his office and pick his brain. Fascinating stuff!

His lectures are amazing. That said, his grading was the most frustrating part of my college career. You can know the material, spend hours writing great papers, and still get mediocre grades with little to no real explanation. He seems to grade on a whim and is outlandishly nitpicky and particular for a 3000 level undergrad class.

Do not take his classes if you expect to do well. You could work your butt off, study for hours, do all the work and he will not care. He'll give you mediocre grades like they mean nothing. His feedback is harsh and not helpful. It was an interesting class and I learned a lot, but it ended up hurting my gpa.

Professor Harrill was very interesting to take classes with. He clearly knew the material and was exited about sharing it with the class. This helped to get the class excited about learning it. He also was very helpful in terms of giving feedback on exams and papers so improvements could be made in the future.

He is a very good lecturer. I have him for History 3219. However, he is a very tough grader, he didn't give a study guide for the midterm so you have to go over EVERYTHING you read and learned in class. It's a very interesting course, but when you write you have to convince him of your point. If you aren't a great writer then don't take this class.
Awesome professor! He helped me so much out of class. He really cares about students, and he obviously loves teaching the Bible! Historically, that is.
Dr. Harrill is very intelligent and passionate about the material he teaches but his grading is simply not justifiable for a course that most people are taking for a general education credit.
Seriously, one of the most engaging professors on campus. I learned a lot in this course.

Dr. Harrill is very passionate about the apostle Paul and it is obvious. He is knowledgeable and willing to help you if you ask for it. He relies heavily on readings and it is often times hard to understand. Extremely difficult for a GE. You must come to class for your own benefit. Grading is justified but strict.

Dr. Harrill is one of the best professors Ive ever had. He knows so much about the Bible, and helpede understand the material. Hes great esp. in office hours! It took me a few weeks to realize that he was pushing us to be better readers of the text. He challenged me to do better than I thought I could do in a humanities class.
Most helpful prof Ive had at OSU! He really got me to read between the lines of a text and understand how to ask questions about historical sources.

Harrill is a nice guy, but his grading is incredibly subjective and picky. I'm a history major and I got As in all my history classes last semester, but a C+ in Harill's INTRODUCTION to history. He does not make clear what he wants on assignments and he grades very harshly.

Dr. Harrill is a great professor, he gives very good lectures, and helps students learn a lot during the course of the class. that said his papers were sometimes nitpicked and graded a bit harsh. There were also a lot of books that were used.
Best prof ever!
Prof. has a clear passion for teaching the Bible.  Enthusiastic teacher who cares about students and helps them learn the material.  Office hours are very helpful.  Fun class!
took his class for a GE and immediately regretted it. Grades are totally subjective so if you have a different opinion than him don't count on getting a good grade.

Honestly, the best class I've taken at OSU.  Eye-opening lectures that really get into detail about the Bible.  Before I took this class, the Bible was so confusing to read.  This class empowered me read the Bible on my own with understanding.  I never realized before this course how important the historical context is!

With so few opportunities to study religion at OSU, this class is wonderful!!  Prof. Harrill really makes you think about the Bible in its historical setting.  He deeply cares about the success of his students.  Amazing teacher!!
What a great class.  Prof Harrill is very friendly and helpful.  He really loves his topic and knows his stuff.  The best college class I've taken.
Best class ever!
Very helpful in office hours!

You will love Harrill's class if you agree with him, and hate it if you disagree. He doesn't allow you to use any sources that disagree with his views, which makes it difficult to substantiate your views in any papers he assigns if you disagree with him, which I found to be extremely frustrating and the cause of low grades on my papers.

As an atheist computer science major... I absolutely loved both courses (Intro to New Testament and Paul and Early Christianity). By far the best professor I've had in 3 years of undergraduate courses. Most angst came from students who came in with strong feelings and felt (ignorantly) under attack, and from students who couldn't write well.

It was an interesting class but do not take it if you are shooting for an easy A.  Only the final is curved and that is minimal.  Other than that you better get A's on both of the papers and both of the exams if you want an A in the class.

Smart but pretentious. I was so excited about this class until I found myself listening to him "put this in undergraduate terms" for us all the time. He really says that--a lot.   The material is interesting and he can occasionally be humorous. Read everything twice and write perfectly. Exams are predictable but LONG.

He's smart, but highly opinionated and almost impossible to please. The syllabus basically says he won't give you an A on the paper. You can be a great writer, but if your paper doesn't agree with his views then you're out of luck. Interesting content, but absolutely too difficult for a GEC and undergraduate level class.

This has turned out to be my favorite class this semester by a significant margin. He presents the material clearly and in an understandable manner while also delivering it in a way that makes it seem exciting. You can't help but pay close attention while in this class.

Great class. Very interesting lectures. Grade was based on 2 term papers, 2 midterms and a final. If you can't write well, you probably won't do well in the papers. Exams are a combination of multiple choice, definitions and short essay questions. They are graded fairly and don't cover anything ridiculous. He clearly cares about the subject.

He grades really reallyhard.  I missed 4 classes and he dropped my grade from a B to a B-.  The exams are all blue book,  even if you know the material (like I did) and write well, it doesnt matter because he will grade on how he feel you did.  I feel like I deserved an A, because I participated and knew the material, but it doesn't matter.

Honestly one of the best classes I've ever taken.  This professor is absolutely outstanding - funny, clear, helpful, and challenging.  He always makes the material interesting, and always considers both sides of an argument.  He does have high standards and his TA graded somewhat hard, but I never felt under-prepared.

summary_comment: Dr. Cox's class is generally considered fairly easy with weekly quizzes and occasional discussion papers. While the final exam can be challenging, particularly due to its length and comprehensiveness, students find her grading to be lenient. The class covers geology and national parks and can be a good general education requirement for those interested in the subject, though some find the lectures tedious and the online format occasionally problematic.

Ratings.comment: Pretty easy GE class 6 papers during the course and and weekly quizzes. The final was a bear, 100 questions and kinda challenging. Not the easiest class but not the worst.

This class isn't bad. If you are not interested in the subject this class may not be for you. However, if you don't mind learning about geology and the national parks this class will be great for a GE. Weekly quizzes and "discussion" papers that were good for your grade given you followed the directions. Lastly, you don't need the textbook.

Good lord, I could not describe just how boring this woman is. It got to the point that I ditched class to pick up more shifts at work, and I still finished with an A. Weekly quizzes and papers. Honestly, put forth a middle school level effort and you'll be just fine. Don't bother buying the textbook, that was a waste of money on my end.

Dr. Cox was a solid choice. Her class consisted of weekly quizzes, a final, and a 2-page discussion every two weeks. She is an easy grader, however, her lectures were very long and tedious. She uses lockdown for the quizzes. Although it was easy, the final was an annoying 100 questions. She is very passionate about what she teaches.

The class was very easy and pretty interesting. Good extra credit opportunities, but you can get an A without extra credit easily. The online format was kind of rough but overall a decent class, and a good natural science GE for non-science people.

I had her online, and Dr. Cox had never taught online before. She definitely struggles a lot with technology which made working with her as an online professor frustrating. A paper each week and a few quizzes before the final, it is a very easy course. I literally never used the textbook and finished with over 100%. Lots of extra credit available.

Fairly easy class. I will say since i took it online this summer it's a little all over the place and you can tell the professor and TA were not prepared to teach through online means. Overall, the info is easy to understand and assignments and extra credit are not too difficult.
Very easy class, Friday quizzes are a pain though. The final exam is cumulative containing quiz questions from the semester

Weekly quizzes, but there is ample extra credit for every one with a cumulative final at the end just make up of previous quiz questions. Easy A if you apply yourself even a little bit, definitely recommend.

Super easy! Dr. Cox is a really kind person and wants her students to do well. She gives out copious amounts of extra credit each class, so much so that I have gotten over a 100% on every quiz this semester. I will say that the material is dry, (it's earth science what can you do) but for the A and GPA booster it is it's WELL WORTH IT!

Honestly just not a fan of Dr. Coxs teaching style. Hour and a half lectures with 150+ slideshows, its hard to take notes. Gives lots of extra credit though, so its a fairly easy A. I probably wouldnt take the class again though because of the dry lectures.

Gives so much extra credit you get over 100 on ever quiz. The final was long and on a lot of material that was hard to memorize, but the extra credit gives you enough credit that there is no way you should walk out of this class with anything lower than an A-. Lectures are kinda boring but would recommend for an easy GE.

She was a really great teacher. She always gives extra credit questions on weekly quizzes which makes not getting over a 100% really difficult. I only needed a 16% on my final to get an A! Definitely take this course!!!

Dr. Cox is a very smart lady and knows more about geology than anyone you'll ever meet. The class is extremely easy, and the extra credit is so much that you barely have to even take the final for an A if you pay attention. I recommend this class for an easy A GE.
Show up to class, get the extra credit, walk out with an A. It's that simple

One of the easiest classes I have taken labs are not hard, she has "attendance checks" sometimes which only consist of 2 points and 1 comes from just being there. Get the extra credit and study that to get easy points on the exam. If you even moderately pay attention in the class and study the extra credit you should have no problem getting an A

She gives a ton of extra credit at the end of lectures that are on the weekly quizzes.  Very easy to get over 100% on quizzes which gives you a huge cushion for the final.  Two in class assignments.  Lectures are put online in the form of a general outline but she adds information.  Only way to get extra credit is to attend class.

Easy A class. Gives extra credit at the end of the lecture. Important test information are usually in bold letters or she mentions it might be a test question out loud during lecture. Just print the lecture notes, go to class, highlight  bolded information on slides or the ones she says might be a test questions, and stay for the extra credit

EASIEST COLLEGE CLASS POSSIBLE! Gave so much extra credit I could fail the final w/ a 33% and still get an A+ in the class. Just spend 5 mins a week to memorize the EC answers for the weekly quizzes and you'll get an A! That being said, the content is extremely boring & I often found myself drifting to sleep in lectures. But the easy A is worth it!
So much extra credit is offered. Interesting material. She is also kinda funny.

Gives a ton of extra credit. There is no midterm instead she gives a quiz once a week with extra credit built in. Easy to get over 100% on the quizzes. One final. Just go to class to get the extra credit questions and to take the pop quizzes she gives on occasions.

This is such an easy and enjoyable GE. Insane amounts of extra credit if you go to class and Christena has a good sense of humor. Most of the powerpoints are pictures from when she visited the parks so it's not a bad lecture to attend.

Professor Cox is well traveled and well versed, I loved sitting through even the most boring ekctures because imaging myself exploring the national parks was so induglent. Many of her slides are her own personal pictures, she has a good sense of humor, and lots of personal stories of her field days. Class is very easy, so much extra credit

Took this class as a GE and was extremely happy I did. I put maybe five hours of total work into this class the entire semester, and stopped going to class after the first midterm and still managed to finish with a total grade over 100. She gives tons of extra credit and the exams aren't hard in the first place. Lab kind of sucks some weeks. Easy A

Dr. Cox is a nice professor but she is VERY liberal amd always seems to make it known.  She offers a lot of extra credit so on exams which is a nice grade boost. Overall I would say take this class just be ready to listen to everything from a liberal point of view

Dr. Cox is pretty funny & an easy grader. She understands that the majority of people are taking this as a GE class. There's a quiz most Fridays rather than midterms. There's also 2 class activities. She offers a 25 point extra credit paper that can count towards your final. No textbook necessary if you go to class. Would recommend.
She is fair and understands that most people take this class as a GE. Lots of bonus if you go to class.

Dr. Cox is a great teacher, granted the subject matter is not all that difficult and she can go on for a while when it comes to a few topics. Her tests are easy, I stopped reading the textbook half way through cause we get everything we need from lecture. pay attention, take notes and your golden. my test grade average was above 100%

Never went to class, but there was so much extra credit I still managed over 100% on both midterms. Just scroll through the PowerPoint outlines on Carmen and get the extra credit from your friends, and you'll be perfectly fine. I had no interest in the topic, but it was clear that she really cares. Great lady. Would recommend as an easy GE.

Dr. Cox is pretty awesome.  She's a teacher that has actually knows what she is talking about.  She gives students a chance to make up for any missed points on tests or labs with extra credit.  I really enjoyed all the knowledge she has to offer as well. As far as her lectures go, I think she made them as interesting as possible!

Easy A. She gives a million extra credit fill-in-the-blanks on her exams. Grade is dependent on 3 tests and labs. Labs are basically giving you an A as 25% of your grade. Tests have ton of extra credit and material isn't that hard to begin with. Can definitely pass without showing up.
Easy A for a GE course. No homework, only exams and labs that are done in class.

Dr. Cox isn't an exciting lecturer, but she does try to be funny. Her PPTs are pretty basic, but some of the material is a LITTLE bit hard to understand (esp for a 1104 class). That being said, there was at least 50pts of extra credit available! I studied 10mins before the quizzes, did the EC paper and studied ~1 hour for the final and got an A!

I had such a hard time staying awake during lectures for this class...Dr. Cox tries really hard to make things interesting, but she reads straight off of the PPT, which she posts on Carmen. There are weekly quizes, and I found them a little hard to study for, but the class itself isn't hard. Lots of extra credit too.

Took this class for a science GE, and would recommend anyone to do the same.  Dr. Cox gives out a plethora of extra credit questions at the end of lectures that she puts on exams.  If you go to class and write down these questions- guaranteed A. The lab is easy. The class is 2 midterms and a cumulative final.  Don't buy the book. TAKE THIS CLASS!

Christena's class is very interesting. The material is straight-forward, and as a geologist, she is incredibly knowledgeable. She gives tons of extra credit, which will save you on the exams. Christena has a wicked sense of humor, and is helpful if you go to class and show an interest in doing well. Great for non-science majors.

She offers a ton of extra credit which is extremely helpful and really knows what she is talking about; lecture is short and simple. I'm not a science major but I could understand what she was talking about
Dr. Cox knows basically everything you could ever know about rocks. She makes the lectures relatively interesting. Many extra credit opportunities. Should be an easy A class
There is so much extra credit in this class. It was crazy easy. Almost no effort. She was really angry all the time though...
Very easy class. No midterms, just quizzes every week. Textbook is "recommended," but she tests on her lecture notes, which are provided on Carmen. Interesting class as well.

Very nice and she really knows her stuff. The tests are all easy if you are in class and there isn't a lot of reliance on the book. I don't know how the class will be under semesters, but if she's teaching I would recommend it.

I think Dr. Cox chose great material to cover for a survey-type course in Geology. She makes the concepts very clear, and goes over information plenty of times. The quizzes are straightforward and easy. Lecture often gets let out early. She worked as a professional geologist in the oil industry for 30 years, and it shows. This lady knows her rocks.

Class was very easy with minimal effort from the students. Textbook is not necessary for a perfect score in the class. Dr. Cox makes things very clear and the quizzes (not midterms) are about as simple as can be. As long as you went to class during the week.

Very basic content, and professor did a good job of making it even easier to understand. I could have skipped classes and passed, but she makes things very clear. There were a few times (with weather) she didn't really know what she was talking about though. Lots of extra credit on quizzes (participation incentives), which are 40% of the grade.
Good class for people who aren't science majors. The teacher makes the subject interesting and explains things in a very clear way. Offers a LOT of extra credit.

I have been awful with science all through high school and college, but with the way she teaches this class, I have never felt more comfortable in a science class. She gives quizzes every week (only 15 questions multiple choice) of what you learned that week...So convenient for me with science being my weak point...really recommend

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for her dedication to student success, offering extensive support through clear lectures, comprehensive study materials, and generous extra credit opportunities. Students consistently praise her approachable nature and her commitment to ensuring understanding, often noting that attending classes regularly leads to good grades.

Ratings.comment: I never had a textbook or really paid attention in class but will still get out with a C. If you don't miss any classes, you'll end up getting 30+ extra credit points. Just don't completely bomb the exams and you're good. I had around a 65% on all of them but  like I said I didn't try. My only goal in this class was to escape with a C.

Easily one of the best professors I've ever had.  She really cares about her students and wants them to be successful and understand everything. She is hilarious during lecture and overall just a really great person with a great attitude towards teaching. If I could take every class with her I would!

Dr Woods will do anything to help her students get good grades. Her lectures are on Power Point and straightforward, she gives out great study guides, and she gives plenty of extra credit, Just show up to class and you'll get a good grade!
Best professor I have ever had. Extremely clear on what to study, always offering help, gives a TON of extra credit, take advantage of it.
Best professor I've had. Very clear and always there to help!

Easily the best TA i've had at OSU She doesn't leave the party room until you understand every single concept. Utilize her as much as you can, that alone can easily bump you up a letter grade if not more. She will make diagrams on the board to help you visualize everything, and she's also really funny.

Natasha is such an awesome TA. She helps students in the best way possible. She has very good clarity, and will repeat a concept over and over until everyone understands. She spends a lot of the time on the chalkboard teaching students in the party room, and this lets the students create a discussion based atmosphere. AWESOME.

Natasha in phenomenal! What a great attitude for anybody in a teaching position to have. Doesn't get frustrated with students, but rather perserveres until they have that "ah-hah" moment. She's been a blessing to a whole lot of students (from my vantage point at least).

Natasha is a TA for Physiology EEOB 232, and she is AMAZING. One of the best I have ever had, she explains things very well and is a pleasure to be around. If you need help she is more than willing to answer every question and go over it multiple times until you understand fully.

summary_comment: The professor is generally effective at preparing students for exams by highlighting key information in class, although his notes do not cover all material tested. Students find his lectures essential for success and note that he can be unorganized and misleading about the course difficulty. Despite some criticism, many appreciate his humor and find the class valuable when attended regularly.

Ratings.comment: Just go to class, he practically tells you what will be on the exam. Like everyone else said, his notes don't cover everything that is tested. Funny guy, but for some reason he thinks the class is way easier than it actually is. maybe because his dad teaches the same course? Not all of us grew up with this stuff. Overall good teacher though

The professor isn't that bad, he wastes alot of time telling stories. the class would only be a half hour long without his rants.  You absolutely have to attend the lectures if you want to do well, because he has the worst notes at OSU.  His powerpoint slides don't make sense if you don't go to lecture.I got an A in the class no thanks to his notes
He's really unorganized. He makes it seem like a really easy A the first few weeks of class. But everyone's been getting C's so far.
He's nice and funny, but a sixth grader could make better slide. Go to every single class or you will miss a lot of test/quiz question which he purposefully leaves out of the slides.
Test and quizzes come directly from the notes. Dave is great and I learned a lot from him.

summary_comment: Professor Courtney excels in teaching the second-year writing requirement, ensuring students can achieve high grades by following her clear rubric guidelines. Her class involves writing a few papers but is highly effective for meeting course objectives.

Ratings.comment: Courtney is awesome. Anyone who needs to fulfill the second year writing requirement - take this class. You write a couple papers, but if you follow her rubric you will get an A.

summary_comment: The professor is perceived as unorganized and condescending, with students finding her often stubborn and defensive when questioned. Her teaching style is seen as ineffective and off-putting, lacking humor and organization, which contrasts sharply with the positive experiences of students in other sections.

Ratings.comment: Not bad. Sometimes a bit stubborn.
She's so unorganized and not funny! Yet she thinks so highly of herself! Which bothers me more. Most of the kids have fun at their survey class, they tell me it's like home. but mine.... ugh.

She's inexperienced and rude to her students. When I asked her a  question she would deflect it or said that she had already answered it. She tends to be very condescending to students as well. She mixes up her facts a lot too like when she said to me that F1 students have to be full time in this summer 2012 quarter.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded, with many students praising his teaching quality and approachability. He is described as patient, kind, and effective, often recommending students for opportunities and maintaining strong connections with them. While some find his tests challenging, most agree that the material is manageable if the book and review questions are studied thoroughly.

Ratings.comment: Definitely my favorite at OSU. He's the entire reason I changed my major to economics, and he even recommended me for a job in the econ department. When I transferred from OSU, he wrote me a great recommendation letter and we keep in touch. If you go to his office hours, you will NOT be sorry. No reason to struggle with Hanfu around. GREAT teacher!
Very nice lectures. An easy-going and kind person

the comment about him being poor quality is incorrect, he puts the review questions on the test and you literally just have to read the book and you'll be absolutely fine. easy class no reason not to get an A
He is very patient and kind.
Pretty easy class, and almost no one attends lecture. All you have to do is read the book and do the review questions and you'll understand it all and get an A.
hard t understand and all his quizes, midterms,and final are ridiculously hard. Barely made it out with a B and I'm a 4.0 student

summary_comment: Pam is highly regarded as an exceptional teacher, consistently praised for her supportive approach and easy-to-follow curriculum. Students appreciate her helpfulness, clear expectations, and willingness to assist, making her classes among the most manageable and beneficial at OSU. Her focus on student success and comprehensive resources contribute to positive learning experiences.

Ratings.comment: Pam is a great teacher and this online class is my easiest class I've ever taken.  She is very helpful by sending out weekly emails and commenting on your discussions.  The small quizzes every week are very easy if you have the textbook.  There are only 5 questions and you have 30 minutes.  I would definitely recommend her and this class!
Very straightforward. As long as you have the textbook, there's no reason not to do well on the weekly quizzes. No exams. Overall, great professor.

Took the online version of the class.  One of the easiest A's you can get.  She give a lot of time for the test (2 hrs) so you can look through the book for answers while taking it, so you have to get the book.  You have one discussion post a week which is based on effort.  Perfect GPA booster.

I took the online version of this class. One of the easiest classes ive taken. Theres an online quiz and discussion every week but you can do a head of time. For midterm and final you have the choice of going and taking multiple choice or doing 3 essay questions. She really is a great teacher and care about her students!

I can't say enough great things about her! She is an excellent professor. She was all about the students. The class was more based on actually learning than on just assignments. She is a very understanding and relaxed person and wants to make sure every succeeds. If this class fulfills a GEC then I would definitely reccommend taking it.
Awesome professor! One of the best at OSU. Went above and beyond to help her students. If you need to take this class...get her!

Pam was a great teacher! You have to go to class to get the blanks for the powerpoints- but she makes this class very interesting. She is also very helpful if you do happen to miss a class, she went over an entire powerpoint with me. She really wants her students to succeed.

Pam is an awesome teacher. She makes sure her students know exactly what to expect and helps them whenever they need it. She puts all her notes online and study guides. Definitely take this class with her!!!

summary_comment: This professor is known for being very laid back and highly helpful, making it one of the easier classes to take according to students.

Ratings.comment: Very laid back and helpful. One of the easiest classes to take.

summary_comment: This professor is generally considered kind and helpful, with clear lecture slides and vocabulary lists that aid in exam preparation. However, some students find her lectures confusing and unhelpful for exam preparation, and she often avoids directly addressing questions. Labs are mandatory and important for understanding the material, though the class is not particularly challenging if one studies the lecture slides thoroughly.

Ratings.comment: She is really kind and helpful. You can definitely understand the knowledge which would be tested through her lecture slides and vocabulary lists she offered before exams. Overall, it is a good class and Deb is a good teacher.

Lectures are not mandatory. I printed off lecture slides before class and took notes on them in class as she was talking. She's  extremely nice and easy going, but she's new. Most of the time what she's saying makes absolutely no sense. She doesn't do a good job preparing you for exams, and if you ask her a question she beats around the bush

This is not a hard class and if you go through all the slides you will do good in exams. She will count differently on the exams so if you did not do the first one well, you still have the chance to improve your final scores. Exams are all multiple choices. And labs are mandatory. Pay attention to the labs cuz sometimes they can be confusing.

She is very nice and easy to talk to. Exams are multiple choice. Just know the terms and the concepts and you'll do fine. Lecture is based off the book. Attendance is not strictly mandatory but it's good to attend lectures because of the random quizzes given. Lab attendance is helpful as well and they're worth the points.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, showing a strong commitment to her students' success. She transforms dull subjects into engaging lessons and goes above and beyond by connecting students with unique opportunities like study abroad programs. Her availability and approachability are matched with clear, direct communication.

Ratings.comment: She is awesome! She is totally invested in helping her students. She made a boring class fun. She hooked me up with a study abroad opportunity I never would have found. She will always make time to help if you have questions & is polite but also direct.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, described as both knowledgeable and supportive, particularly in her willingness to assist students with their inquiries in the online Spanish 121 course at the University of Louisville.

Ratings.comment: I took her online for Spanish 121 at University of Louisville and it was fantastic. She is a great helper and is super smart and willing to answer questions!

summary_comment: This professor is perceived as ineffective and unengaging, with one student describing her as "boring" and another stating they "did not like her AT ALL as a teacher." While some assignments, like quizzes, were challenging, many students found the class to be more demanding than expected and felt frustrated by unclear feedback and difficult, unprepared-for assessments.

Ratings.comment: Basically this prof. doesn't do anything.

This 2 credit hour class was more involved than my other 14 hours combined.  The quizzes were difficult and timed.  Papers due several times, and she made discussion questions due in class to make people come.  I would recommend NOT taking this course if she is the teacher, as it is no where near the cake-walk I imagined.

I took this class online.  The teacher tried to keep us updated on what we needed to be doing, but did not do a good job at all.  The quizzes were fairly easy, along with the other assignments.  When we did get points off on papers or discussions she did not tell us why.  Class could have been much better than it was.

nice lady but just a boring teacher. online quizes were hard to do well on. for a class that i thought would be a breeze i hated it. ended up with an A- but barely, and with a lot of hate for robin dunn!!

i did not like her AT ALL as a teacher. this a very interesting topic and she actually makes it BORING.  all quizes and tests were on line but she asks questions that she has only mentioned once and are impossible to look up in the book.  she is just not fun!
